Description: Rim sherd of East Greek (North Ionian) black-figured pottery bowl; interior glazed save for broad reserved band near lip; decoration in added red and white, from top: white zig-zag; red band between white bands; exterior, cream slip: at lip, between bands, frieze of tongues with dots in interstices; below, zig-zag band dotted likewise; handle zone frieze preserves scant remains of an animal, probably a panther to right. Two drill holes for sampling.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ3, Φ4 or Φ7.
Curator's comments: Attributed to the production centre Teos through NAA (Hans Mommsen, Bonn: sample Nauk 99, NAA group TeosB).
From same vessel as 1888,0601.532a-d and f-h, and Oxford, Ashmolean G.119.39
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 243. no. 6)
Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (pp. 42, 48, pl. VIII, no. 1-2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GI.006)
